Key Match Events: South Africa beat England by seven runs to close on semi-finals
England finish on 156-6 in pursuit of 164 in Saint Lucia
Harry Brook and Liam Livingstone shared a 78-run partnership
Quinton de Kock top-scores with 65 and David Miller adds 43
Jofra Archer takes 3-40 and Jos Buttler claims superb catch and run out
Aiden Markram's catch to dismiss Harry Brook was a turning point
England needed 25 from 18 balls but South Africa closed out for the win
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa captain Aiden Markram praised the team's fighting spirit and skill
Jos Buttler reflected on the powerplay as the difference in the match
Buttler also praised the partnership between Brook and Livingstone
Quinton de Kock focused on batting as long as he could and praised the team's bowling in the powerplay
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa's bowling attack of Jansen, Nortje, Rabada, Maharaj, Baartman, and Shamsi is formidable
South Africa are sitting at the top of group two with wins over West Indies and England
England still hold second spot but need a big win against USA
Australia and India join South Africa in the unbeaten club in group one
